The Origanum genus (Lamiaceae family) includes approximately 38 species that have been studied extensively for potential importance, and uses in flavoring foods and traditional medicine due to their pharmacological characteristics
1 . Origanum species are widely distributed in North Africa, eastern Mediterranean, and Siberian regions. According to Kokkini
2 , Origanum taxa are rich in essential oils that exhibit well-known antioxidant and antimicrobial properties. Based on the chemical composition of essential oils, Origanum species have been classified into three main chemotypes: thymol/carvacrol, linalool/terpinen-4-ol, and sesquiterpenes.
